title: How to Become a Pro at Bee Swarm Simulator

steps.title: Then convert your pollen to honey.
steps.content: Then convert your pollen to honey. Keep your eye on something you want to purchase, then save up honey so you can buy it. You can gradually work your way up or just go for it completely. You can also save up tickets to purchase really good bees from the ticket tent.

steps.title: Purchasing more basic eggs can help.
steps.content: Purchasing more basic eggs can help. The more bees you have in your hive, the more pollen you will get per second. You can also unlock more places, such as the pro shop, with more bees. Bees can also help you attack so you can get rewards from rhino beetles, ladybugs, and more. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Battling helps you earn rewards like honey tokens, royal jelly, and gumdrops.
steps.content: Battling helps you earn rewards like honey tokens, royal jelly, and gumdrops. You can battle rhino beetles, ladybugs, spiders, werewolves, and more. Keep in mind that different creatures drop different items, ladybugs usually drop strawberries, spiders sometimes drop royal jelly, and rhino beetles usually drop blueberries.

steps.title: Using items is fundamental to becoming a pro.
steps.content: Using items is fundamental to becoming a pro. Royal jelly can transform bees into different ones. Sometimes, you'll get a better bee than you had before. Using gumdrops boosts your honey collection by two times, and using field dice boosts a random field. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Feeding treats, like strawberries and blueberries, helps your bees level up.
steps.content: Feeding treats, like strawberries and blueberries, helps your bees level up. Leveling up your bees improves their stats, meaning you can earn pollen faster. Keep in mind that other bees like strawberries more than the other, and other bees like blueberries more than the other, so you can boost them faster than your other bees.

steps.title: Doing quests can earn you rewards as well.
steps.content: Doing quests can earn you rewards as well. Sometimes, you can get amazing rewards like gold eggs, silver eggs, and possibly even diamond eggs! You'll have to work hard to get these rewards, but it will be worth it. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Summoning a random sprout can help you a lot.
steps.content: Summoning a random sprout can help you a lot. You'll have to click away, but in the end, the field the sprout was in will be flooding with tokens. After a while, though, the tokens will disappear, so try to get as much as you can! The rewards are greater for rarer sprouts. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Tiny glowing bees (fireflies) will come down to a random field at night.
steps.content: Tiny glowing bees (fireflies) will come down to a random field at night. They will settle someplace on the ground, and if you walk on top of them, you can get many rewards. Usually, they will also leave at least one moon charm. If you have 100 moon charms, you can use them to make one moon amulet, which can give helpful buffs. There is also a chance of a Vicious Bee spawning! You can get stingers by defeating it, which you can use to get a Vicious Bee after you get 250.

steps.title: Using promo codes is an easy way to get buffs and rewards.
steps.content: Using promo codes is an easy way to get buffs and rewards. You can find these promo codes by googling them online, or you can go to the developer's Twitter account. If you have just started Bee Swarm Simulator, this can help you get a good start! It also has good boosts though, so you might want to save some for later and not use it all at once. [5] X Research source

steps.title: If you have 20 bees and an ant pass, you can do the ant challenge!
steps.content: If you have 20 bees and an ant pass, you can do the ant challenge! Everything you collect there instantly converts into honey, so you can get a lot of honey quickly. You have to fight ants as a bar gradually goes higher until you go to the next round. You have a few minutes to do it. After you finish, you get tons of rewards. You can even get an ant amulet, which grants really useful buffs and boosts. You can get a free ant pass every few hours.

steps.title: When a bee is gifted, its stats are significantly boosted.
steps.content: When a bee is gifted, its stats are significantly boosted. This offers a variety of things that can help your pollen collecting. Using a star jelly can transform a bee into a randomly gifted bee, and using a star treat turns a bee gifted. Be careful on what you use star jelly and star treats on as they are very rare. Try to use star treats on a bee that already has good stats so you can improve them even more.

steps.title: Once you unlock the 35 Bee Gate, you can have access to the Wind Shrine!
steps.content: Once you unlock the 35 Bee Gate, you can have access to the Wind Shrine! Donating can give you field boosts and more! However, rarer items grant more rewards, like greater field boosts.

steps.title: There are a lot of memory matches out there, and you can get great rewards.
steps.content: There are a lot of memory matches out there, and you can get great rewards. You can get certain badges to get more chances on the memory match. You may even get mythic eggs, star jelly, and star treats! Don't waste all your honey on these, though.

steps.title: Beesmas is an annual event that usually occurs from around late December to March.
steps.content: Beesmas is an annual event that usually occurs from around late December to March. With the arrival of Beesmas, you can get new quests from Bee Bear! You can also do special Beesmas quests from other bears, and finishing more quests unlocks more things. Like gift boxes, which you can open after completing a certain amount. You can also unlock things like the Honey Wreath, Stockings, and Gingerbread House! During Beesmas, you can get things like Gingerbread Bears and Snowflakes! These are very useful because you can purchase items in the Bee Bear Catalog with these, even a mythic egg!
